keyTakeAways: A former New York prison guard, David Kingsley, was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter in the beating death of inmate Robert Brooks.
Two other guards, Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer, were acquitted of murder charges despite being charged with first-degree manslaughter and second-degree gang assault.
The body-camera footage showing Brooks being punched, stomped, and lifted by the neck without sound became a pivotal piece of evidence in the trial.
Prosecutors argued that all guards acted as a gang, collectively showing 'depraved indifference to human life' in their actions.
Brooks, serving a 12-year sentence for first-degree assault, was transferred to Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024, where he was brutally beaten three times.
The case is notable for involving a special prosecutor, William Fitzpatrick, who took over due to Attorney General Letitia Jamesâ€™s recusal from representing prison officers in civil lawsuits.
Fitzpatrick is prosecuting a similar case involving the death of Messiah Nantwi at Mid-State Correctional Facility, indicating ongoing systemic scrutiny of prison guard conduct.
Six of the 10 guards indicted were charged with murder, with five previously pleading guilty to manslaughter and one to a misdemeanor charge of attempted tampering with evidence.
Three more guards have agreed to plead guilty to reduced charges and are cooperating with prosecutors, including two who testified at trial.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A former New York prison guard, David Kingsley, was found guilty of murder and first-degree manslaughter in the death of inmate Robert Brooks, who was beaten three times upon arrival at Marcy Correctional Facility on December 9, 2024. The body-camera footage, which showed guards punching, stomping, and lifting Brooks by the neck without sound, played a central role in the trial. Two other guards, Mathew Galliher and Nicholas Kieffer, were acquitted of murder charges, despite being charged with manslaughter and gang assault. The prosecution argued that all guards acted as a gang with 'depraved indifference to human life.' The case is part of a broader pattern of inmate violence, as similar fatal incidents have occurred at nearby Mid-State Correctional Facility involving Messiah Nantwi. District Attorney William Fitzpatrick, who took over the case due to Attorney General Letitia James's recusal, is prosecuting both cases, highlighting systemic concerns about prison guard conduct and oversight.
title: Former New York State Prison Guard Found Guilty in Death of Inmate Beaten, 2 Others Acquitted
